Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of man. Torso fragment with paunch, probably an actor. Mould-made and hollow. Dark red-brown Nile silt fabric with black core. Abundant fine gold mica, quartz and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Body of an actor or merchant figurine. Probably locally produced at the Naukratis Terracottas workshop operational from the 3rd to 2nd century BC.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.295) (Phase 1)
